title: Prep girls basketball: Inaugural Badger Conference Challenge on the horizon
title_page: Prep girls basketball: Inaugural Badger Conference Challenge on the horizon
maintext:
The first Badger Conference Girls Basketball Challenge is scheduled for Jan. 12 and 13 at Stoughton High School.
Game times on Friday, Jan. 12, will be 6 p.m. and 7:30 p.m. Game times on Saturday, Jan. 13, will be 10:30 a.m. (JV/JV2), noon, 1:30 p.m., 3 p.m., 4:30 p.m., 6 p.m. and 7:30 p.m.
The first-place game will be at 7:30 p.m. Jan. 13.
Pairings based on standings in the Badger South Conference and Badger North Conference are scheduled to be announced this Saturday.
It is likely Beaver Dam, the current Badger North Conference leader and top-ranked in Division 2 in the WisSports.net state coaches’ rankings, and Monroe, the current Badger South leader and No. 2 in Division 2, will meet in the first-place game at the Badger Challenge.
Varsity games will be played in Stoughton’s main gymnasium. JV2 and JV games will be played in the Field House.
The Badger South teams will be the home teams.
Admission will be $5 per day, with wrist bands issues Saturday.
A percentage of the revenue is scheduled to be donated to a charitable organization announced at the event.
The Badger Conference has held a similar challenge for boys and added the girls challenge starting this season.
The boys challenge is scheduled this season for Oregon High School and will be a week after the girls’ event.
